meanings.definition: To look sullen or threatening in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: She loured at the dark clouds gathering in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The teacher loured at the misbehaving student.
meanings.sent3: The cat loured at the mouse, ready to pounce.
meanings.sent4: The storm loured on the horizon, promising heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: His father's louring expression made him realize he was in trouble.

meanings.definition: To entice or lure someone in a deceptive way.
meanings.sent1: The scammer loured unsuspecting victims with false promises.
meanings.sent2: The witch loured children into her gingerbread house.
meanings.sent3: The con artist loured people into investing in fake schemes.
meanings.sent4: The sly fox loured the rabbit out of its burrow.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map loured adventurers into the dangerous jungle.
